instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message:
Hello, i have a macbook air with some liquid damage.. i clean very very well the board but this not turn on anymore.
before the clean, sometimes if i have some good luck this board turn on.

my measures:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C3080</CAPACITOR> 8,57v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R7202</RESISTOR> 8,57v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7500</CAPACITOR> 8,57v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> 16,93v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> 16,91v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C5006</CAPACITOR> 3,39v

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> 3,39v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> 2,76v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C4690</CAPACITOR> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C3550</CAPACITOR> 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> @ Pin 5 <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> 3,35v

i see <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> too low but i dont know why

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C3550</CAPACITOR> 0v..... Hmm.... Let's think about that. What component generates your 3v and 5v rails?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message: Let's look at page 52 of the schematic... Notice the pattern?<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> Missing. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> missing. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> low.. Let's think here... Why would a rail go low? Perhaps the buck controller is screwed up? Perhaps there's a short pulling the line down?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 21962"]Let's look at page 52 of the schematic... Notice the pattern?<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> Missing. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> missing. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> low.. Let's think here... Why would a rail go low? Perhaps the buck controller is screwed up? Perhaps there's a short pulling the line down? [/QUOTE]

What do you mean when you say "the buck controller" ? So, how i do to know if this si a short?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message:
Before going further, Learn how to find a short. 

Here is what a buck converter is
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B5eWpRFC9Aw&list=PLkVbIsAWN2ltOWmriIdOc5CtiZqUTH7GT&index=11[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 21965"]Before going further, Learn how to find a short.

Here is what a buck converter is
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B5eWpRFC9Aw&list=PLkVbIsAWN2ltOWmriIdOc5CtiZqUTH7GT&index=11[/url][/QUOTE]

ya i know whats is a buck converter.. so, you suggest to change the <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>? or <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message:
Before replacing <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> make sure you are getting 8.5v on pin 23 and 3.42v on pin 12.

If that is the case, then check resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>.

If resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is high enough to not be considered a short circuit to ground, replace <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

Do not touch <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air, green light , not turns on
threads.message: i Have 8,57v at pin 23 and 3,38v at pin 12 of the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.. The measures of the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> at the L4820 in diode mode have 508 and the resistance mode have 472 ohms. always red probe to ground.. trying with the black probe to ground dont have any measure.
